lead_paragraph: A transitional government will be installed in a daylong ceremony Thursday in the capital, Bujumbura, with the aim of ending eight years of civil war. The tiny central African nation has been ripped apart by ethnic conflict between the Hutu majority and the Tutsi, who despite being in a minority have held power almost exclusively since independence from Belgium in 1962.
abstract: Burundi, seeking to end 8-year civil war, is set to install transitional government (S)
